isis.stitle: 9 SPEED AND 11 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTO-1X707LL/DLL/MLL AND RTO-1X709MLL MODELS - ASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: GEAR SHIFT LEVER
svcproc.para: Inspect tension spring and washer for wear. Replace if necessary.

Apply Eaton rust preventative lubricant #71212 or equivalent to the shift lever pivot ball. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended lubes. A lubricant film should cover all surfaces between and including the pivot ball.
Seat the tension spring one coil at a time.

step1.para: Secure the assembly in a vise with the bottom of the housing facing up ( Figure 123).
If the spade pin is damaged, replace and install the new spade pin in the housing tower bore ( Figure 123).
In models so equipped, install the nut and washer in the housing bore.
If the O-ring is damaged, replace and lubricate the O-ring with Eaton/Fuller lubricant #71206 supplied with the O-ring kit. Install the O-ring in the housing tower inside the groove ( Figure 123).
Align the lever ball slot with the spade pin and position the gear shift lever in the housing tower ( Figure 124).
Install the washer over the ball with dished side up Figure 124).
Use a tension spring driver to install the tension spring under the housing lugs ( Figure 125).
Remove the assembly from the vise.
Install a rubber boot over the gear shift lever and against the housing.

svcproc.para: Make sure the gear shift lever can move.
